subtasks: Approach the combine.
Open the tape attachment mechanism on the combine.
Cut the appropriate length of tape for the combine's hitch.
Insert the tape into the combine's hitch mechanism.
Secure the tape to the combine, ensuring it is tight and properly attached.
Check the attachment from multiple angles to confirm proper securing.
Access the combine's engine compartment.
Locate the ignition switch or start button.
Engage the choke if necessary.
Turn the key or press the start button to initiate the engine.
Monitor the engine's start-up to ensure it runs smoothly.
Enter the combine cab and sit in the driver's seat.
Secure seatbelt or safety harness if available.
Adjust mirrors and view the surrounding area for obstructions.
Activate the combine's lights to ensure visibility.
Check mirrors for oncoming traffic or other obstructions.
Sound the horn to alert nearby pedestrians or animals.
Check mirrors again for nearing vehicles or potential hazards.
Engage the combine's transport gear to start moving forward.
Drive the combine forward in the desired direction.
Monitor the combine's operation and adjust settings as needed.
Communicate with the operator or nearby personnel if assistance is required.

tasks.task: Guide the combine to the field path.
subtasks: Plan the route to the field path while considering the combine's current position.
Use the combine's controls to steer it along the intended path.
Align the combine's direction with the path leading to the field.
Adjust the combine's speed to match the desired navigational pace.

tasks.task: Drive the combine on the field path.
subtasks: Continue to steer the combine along the designated field path.
Monitor the combine's position relative to the crop rows.
Adjust the steering to maintain the proper path within the field.
Monitor for any obstacles or uneven terrain along the path.
Take appropriate action to avoid obstacles, such as slowing down or adjusting direction.

tasks.task: Wait for people at the path.
subtasks: Pull the combine to a stop at the designated meeting point on the field path.
Turn off the combine's engine to save fuel or prepare for unloading.
Engage the parking brake for safety.
Open the combine's grain unloader chute or direct the unloading process.
Coordinate with the people arriving at the path to unload the grain or harvest product.
Access the combine's rear shaker screen area.
Check the operation of the shakers by running the combine and observing the movement.
Adjust the shaker settings as needed to optimize grain separation.
Ensure the shakers are clean and free of debris.
Lubricate or oil moving parts as necessary.
Calculate the remaining field area to determine when to change direction or adjust pattern.
Plan the overlapping path to cover all areas of the field without missing spots.
Adjust the combine's path to overlap rows by a predetermined width, usually 10-15%.
Monitor the overlap to ensure consistent coverage and adjust direction as needed.
Locate the combine's oil dipstick or indicator.
Remove the dipstick and reinsert it to check the oil level.
Compare the oil level to the proper range marked on the dipstick.
If necessary, add oil through the appropriate fill port.
Ensure the oil is of the correct type for the combine.

tasks.task: Add or refill oil on the combine.
subtasks: Identify the correct type and quantity of oil needed.
Locate the expected oil reservoir or fill port on the combine.
Open the fill port and attach the measuring scoop or container.
Transfer the oil from the container into the reservoir, measuring as you pour.
Close the fill port securely after refilling.
Wipe any spills or excess oil.
Check the oil level again using the dipstick to verify the proper fill.

tasks.task: Finish the work on the combine when done.
subtasks: Return the combine to its storage location.
Turn off the engine and engage the parking brake.
Disconnect the tapes or any attachments used on the combine.
Shut down the combine systems as necessary.
Clean the combine if needed, removing any debris or visible dirt.
Record any maintenance or operational notes for future reference.
